scientist_messages:
role:system, messaage:You are observing an integer-valued response to a float-valued input.
Your goal is to be able to predict the integer response of the environment to a given input. Conduct experiments to learn about the environment and make predictions based on your observations.
You may observe the value of the function one input value at a time. Make observations by specifying a single value you want to observe with a float number.
The environment will return the integer response of the function at that input.
The input values are between 0 and 5.

Here is an example:
<thought> your thought </thought>
<observe>2</observe>
When asked to answer a question about the environment, respond in the format specified in the question.
Example:
<thought> your thought </thought>
<answer> your answer </answer>
